rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about children being removed from their parents, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. A council can apply for a care order if it believes a child is suffering or at risk of suffering significant harm, and it is up to the courts whether to grant such an order.

If you want the Government to remove all powers for courts to order that children aged 0-2 be taken into care, irrespective of any evidence of suffering significant harm or risk of suffering significant harm, you could start a new petition requesting this. If you want to see other changes to existing arrangements for taking children into care, you could start a new petition explaining more clearly what changes you want the Government to make.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Stop courts being able to grant care orders based on risk of future suffering: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/556185

End forced adoption: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/585387
